newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel oil treads water, barges rest above $80.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel oil treads water, barges rest above $80.

text.p: NWE fuel oil prices treaded water on Thursday in thin business with little to move the market, dealers said.

High sulphur barges drifted down a little to trade at $81, $81.50 and $82 fob ARA. Traders said there was stubborn resistance to going lower, with $81 a strong barrier and $80 unlikely to be breached imminently.
"It's a boring market but it does look as if its bottoming out," said one barge trader.
Strong prices for fuel oil in Asia were supportive of demand in Rotterdam, traders said.
Rumours continued that material would move out of the Mediterranean to Asia, with opinions differing on whether the arbitrage window was open wide enough to justify the transit.
A German trader was heard to have bought 50kt of end-April barrels from Italy at either high quotes plus 25 cents or $1, to take to the Far East.
High sulphur buyers in Europe saw movement to Asia as mildly supportive of price in the short term but were still calling bearish numbers.
Utilities were holding down bids with the $75 cif number floated on Wednesday still in the market with few firm numbers heard from sellers.

Low sulphur cracked was little discussed, though a small requirement into Denmark was heard filled with poor quality high density material at $89.25 delivered. Supply, though tighter, was considered still good given weak demand. - London newsroom +44 171 542 8060
